headline: Chicken Parmigiana
description: This chicken parmigiana recipe is made with breaded chicken breasts baked with spaghetti sauce and cheese in this tasty, family-friendly Italian dish.

video.description: Make this quick and easy version of chicken Parmigiana.
video.name: Chicken Parmigiana

name: Chicken Parmigiana

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking sheet.
Pour egg into a small shallow bowl. Place bread crumbs in a separate shallow bowl. Dip chicken into egg, then into bread crumbs. Place coated chicken on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven.

Pour 1/2 of the spaghetti sauce into a 7x11-inch baking dish. Place chicken breasts over the sauce, then cover with remaining sauce. Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top. Continue baking until heated through and cheeses have melted, about 20 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: I used a jar of sauce that I had on hand, spiced it up with tomato&basil added crush red pepper, garlic & oregano, we like a little kick to it. It came out so delicious!
Very good and simple!
the Italian way is to sauté the chicken, than top with mozzarella cheese and bake. it comes out very tender.

Very good an easy to make. I used Classico Spaghetti sauce and melted butter instead of egg. Very tender and moist, not dry at all for a chicken breast. The bread crumbs didn't totally stick when I shifted the chicken into the second pan, maybe I should have used egg, but it worked overall. Made a serving of Spaghetti noodles to round out the dinner. Will make again.
Liked this recipe and want to make it again to take to someone getting out of hospital. Did anyone try freezing this and cook it another day?

I used cutlets which were thin and did the original baking for 30 minutes then the baking with sauce and cheeses for an additional 20 minutes. It came out so delicious. For sure will make again. I hate to fry anything and this is perfection!!
This is a simple, but tasty recipe. I add parmesan cheese to the bread crumbs.

Used thinner chicken breasts to cut back the baking time a bit - 20 minutes breasts alone then another 20 with the sauce and cheese toppings. Or you can pound out bigger chicken breasts to make them all about the same thickness. (You may want to use a food thermometer to make sure the middle of the thickest chicken breast gets to 165 degrees.) Use lots of sauce under and on the chicken so that you have enough for your pasta as well. I also added Italian seasoning and a sprinkle of seasoned salt to the bread crumbs. Chicken came out tender and tasty!
This was really easy and was actually really good. Makes a good left over sandwich too.
We make this often it’s a family favorite. The only thing I change is instead of spaghetti sauce we substitute our own home made marinera sauce which we make on the spicy side.
Very simple & quick . My family loved it
Super good! Used panko and baked on a cookie cooling rack. Served w steamed veggies for the WIN
made this for my boyfriend and he LIVED for it!
So easy and tasted delicious!
My family loved this recipe. I followed it as is and only raised the oven to 400 degrees for the last 5 minutes.
Amazing and straight to the point! a must make again and again!

Made with tenderloins and overcooked, but aside from my own mistake, this was a good recipe. I used to brown the chicken rather than bake it before adding it to the sauce. Baking kept the breadcrumbs from sticking to the frying pan which was always a problem before.

It was good, but I like my flavors a little more complex. Next time I either need to use a different sauce (not just marinara), jazz it up with garlic powder, or work on the breading. Sauce would be the easiest.
My children loves it! I never knew that Chicken Parmigiana is this simple & tasty. #majorlove
This was. A really good recipe especially with some basic homemade sauce. I would recommend adding seasoning to the breadcrumbs (oregano, basil, salt, pepper, etc) as they were a bit bland

Excellent recipe! Very easy too. I pounded 2 chicken breasts, which I seasoned with s/p & garlic powder. Seasoned panko crumbs and baked on a wire rack over a cookie sheet, about 23 minutes. Seasoned a jar of marinara and added 1/2 to a 9x13 dish. Laid the chicken on top then shredded mozzarella and fresh parmesan. Baked until bubbly, about 13 minutes. Warmed up remainder sauce to serve a few dollops on the plated chicken and vegetable spaghetti. Loved it!
I made this for my family and we loved it! Very simple and delicious! Will be making this again!
Taste great. Family happy. Easy to follow recipe for non-chef bachelor.

I made this according to the recipe, only letting the chicken sit in a brind for 4 hours and the chicken was juicy. I also used Panko crumbs because I had them available. The chicken was delicious. I will make again.
Absolutely the best!! No words , I am speechless and that never happens
Very easy to create. I did add a little Italian to the bread crumbs for a little extra flavor.
Great dinner for the family.

Turned out great and family love it! Did not cover the chicken with sauce after placing in baking dish so it would turn out crispier, which it did but also fried the cheese. Good thing I love nearly burned crispy cheese!
Tastes great! I’m still trying to figure out why the listed prep time is 30 minutes, though. Took me maybe 15 at most.
The kids loved it! I will definitely make again.
This came out so good, and it was really easy!
This recipe was very easy. It was extremely good!
awesome!!

I’m a mother of infant twins. , So anything I make has to be fast and easy. This was both and it sure felt good to put an actual something on the table tonight that wasn’t from a box. Sure if you want to kick it up a notch, add the spices everyone suggests, I’m sure it would be delicious. But it’s pretty good as is (which probably depends on the sauce you use since there are really no spices in the recipe) and I could throw it together, no problem.
Delicious and easy. Will pound the chicken breasts next time as suggested.
Very easy to follow recipe although I used a little less sauce but overall fantastic.
Turned out great. The family loved it.

The prepared spaghetti sauce ruined it for me but making it again I used a 5 minute sauce from tomato sauce, basil, oregano, tarragon, fresh garlic, salt and pepper. Other than that I’ll be making this often, Now it is part of my go to recipes. Whole family loves this.
Delicious
Everyone enjoyed it! And it was easy to make! Thank you

I made this just as the recipe stated and my man can’t stop eating it. The reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars is because it needed more sauce. I recommend the whole jar or equivalent to if your making homemade. The only adjustment I made was pre flouring the chicken 10 minutes before coating in the egg then I used seasoned Pablo instead of bread crumbs because that’s what we use in this house. It has a better crunch factor.
Delicious to me. Added a plantain because I had one lol
My family loved it the only change Imade was I used was boneless skinless thighs
it tasted so good . Came out perfectly on my first try .
A nice,simple recipe. I changed out the tomato sauce with salsa (I hadsome left over) and it added a tasty zing. I will definitely make this recipe again (as written by poster.)
A nice,simple recipe. I changed out the tomato sauce with salsa (I hadsome left over) and it added a tasty zing. I will definitely make this recipe again (as written by poster.)
Easy and the kids loved it! I will add more chicken next time so it goes further
I made this as written and found it to be very bland. It definitely needs more flavoring!
I made this as written and found it to be very bland. It definitely needs more flavoring!
It was amazing, my husband loved it. It was so delicious, and came out good the first time I made it.
I’ve made this a dozen times. I add Parmesan cheese to the breadcrumb mix so it gets cooked in the breading. And I use thinly sliced and tenderized breasts and reduce cooking time by 10 min.

Simple recipe to build on! I added basil, oregano, minced garlic and onion powder to the chicken and the sauce. The chicken was tender and flavorful paired with veggie pasta tossed in oil and balsamic vinegar reduction. The flavor composition was outstanding!
I made this with turkey. And I also didn't fry the turkey. I used the bread crumbs on top. Yummo.
I loved it ??
Made as directed with additional Italian seasonings. Super easy simple. A better quality pasta sauce than what I had would make it even better.

A simple recipe for a wonderful meal! The only differences in preparation was that I added some garlic powder and parmesan to the bread crumbs, as well as using a tenderizer to flatten the chicken out. We also used chunks of fresh mozzarella as well as shredded mozzarella, which I highly recommend! Garlic bread and a pot of linguine made this a fantastic dinner, and one I plan to make often.
This is really easy and oh, SO good!!
Melted in my mouth!!!!
Boring. Would be better with some Italian spices and provolone cheese
Awesome recipe easy I added dry basil on top and a basil pasta sauce easy recipe to follow
GREAT DINNER! I made homemade sauce I had in the freezer that made the dish even better.
Excellent recipe all around. Chicken is tender and juicy. Served with pasta, it is quite a feast!
I made this with the recommendations of adding pepper and Italian seasoning. Baked 15 minutes turned and another 15. Didn’t add sauce to top till after finished. Was wonderful! Will make this again.
Quick and easy to make and delicious!
I thought this was just kind of blah :/ I'd add a lot more seasonings if I made it again
easy very good taste will make it again
so easy and tasty

Turned out delicious! Though I didn't really experiment, you can probably improve the taste by using a better spaghetti sauce, or making your own. Also, chicken breast seem to come larger these days, so I had to increase the cooking time by about 25%. Otherwise, quick and easy, family loved it!
Next time I'll try it with a more granular breadcrumb. My breadcrumb was very fine, which didn't hold up as a crunchy crust after baking.

Overall, this recipe was really good. I made a couple of adaptations based on what I had. I used 1 XL chicken thigh and cut it into 4 pieces, which cut the cooking time to 25ish mins (I left it in for 28 min which was a little too long). I also like more breading so I double battered them (which used up the entire egg perfectly). I put way too much sauce on though, I'll definitely cut that down next time. Definitely will make again though!
It is a good standard chicken parm recipe
Blah. It was ok, but I probably won't make again. Maybe it was the sauce I used, but I found it a bit dry and not very interesting.
I have made this its easy and good. I just added some angel hair pasta when plating and set chicken on top very good and easy.
Amazing!! Most recipes for this have wayyyy to many steps!! This is flavorful, easy and doesn’t require soooo many steps/ingredients.. it’s a staple in our home!!
Thanks to Candy. This meet restaurant quality. I like to add more cheese.
Really good and easy.

My family loved this recipe. 2 things I did differently were 1. I fried the chicken on both sides for 5 minutes after I dipped it in egg and bread crumbs, 2. I heated up the sauce on the stovetop before putting in the oven. I was short on time and wanted to be sure chicken was thoroughly cooked! Thank you for sharing your recipe. Made for an easy and delicious evening meal!
This recipe is easy and delicious! No changes required.
Easy to make and my two picky kids love it.
I did everything as is. The only thing I would do different is not add so much sauce. Everything else was perfect
This dish has become a staple in my menu at home.
Tasty and easy to make! I served angel hair pasta and zucchini fries with it.

I like that the chicken is baked and not fried. I sliced the boneless chicken breast into thinner pieces so baked them at 400 degrees for 30 min. I also baked eggplant at the same time with the same egg dip and bread crumbs. My husband and I both really liked the results.
New family favorite. Made the sauce myself and added basil, oregano, sage, garlic, sat and pepper to the breaded crumbs. Delicious
First time cooking and my wife loved it.
I will definitely make it again. Easy to make and delicious!
Great!! I used Italian bread crumbs. Great husband pleaser.

I loved this recipe. The only extra things I did was add a little extra mozzarella on top when I plated it and I cooked the noodles while the chicken and sauce was cooking. It ended up timing out perfectly.
This was so simple I was afraid it would be a flop. Wrong! easy and delicious. I will definitely make this again and again.

My husband loved this. It is so quick and easy to make compared to other recipes that have so many ingredients. Perfect. I don't think I did anything different but add my own spices to the bread crumb mix...I used roasted garlic bread crumbs, onion powder, oregano, basil and parsley, I would have just used my Italian seasoning mix but I was out so I used what I had.
This is one of my favorite recipes I have found on Allrecipes. It's absolutely perfect, and incredible over pasta and zucchini spirals.
This was simply beyond Amazinggggg!! I follow the recipe but added a few more things to it, but overall it was a super easy dish to make, my bf loved it!!!!
Easy to make, liked by everyone in my family and that can sometimes be a challenge. I served it over spaghetti.
I think this is the worst basic recipe I've ever found for chicken parm.
I opened up the chicken and butterflied them first (like a pork chop) . Top with with sautéed red peppers and onions and serve on a big Portuguese bun.
Yes I'll make this again, easy to make . Ill spend more time getting the breading better. Two thumbs up from the kids, Overall very good.
Excellent. We both went Gaga over it!
Extremely easy. Because I was making it for a "covered dish" affair, I actually cut the chicken breasts into small strips but followed the receipe on everything else. It disappeared quickly.
Instead of using egg, I slathered sour cream all over the chicken before I dipped it in bread crumbs. It was delicious!
